content.en: Surgical algorithm advancements: Researchers have developed algorithms to address various medical questions related to surgical procedures. For example, an algorithm called Vacuum-assisted Fascial Closure (VAFC) has been developed to reduce the rate of planned ventral hernia after open abdomen surgery. Another algorithm combines delayed primary closure, vacuum-assisted fascial closure, Wittmann Patch, and planned ventral hernia to manage the open abdomen. These algorithms aim to improve patient outcomes and guide surgeons in making informed decisions.
content.da: Fremskridt inden for kirurgiske algoritmer: Forskere har udviklet algoritmer til at besvare forskellige medicinske spørgsmål relateret til kirurgiske procedurer. For eksempel er en algoritme kaldet Vacuum-assisted Fascial Closure (VAFC) blevet udviklet for at reducere forekomsten af planlagt ventral hernie efter åben mavekirurgi. En anden algoritme kombinerer forsinket primær lukning, vakuumassisteret fascial lukning, Wittmann Patch og planlagt ventral hernie til at håndtere den åbne mave. Disse algoritmer har til formål at forbedre patientresultater og vejlede kirurger i at træffe informerede beslutninger.
